snippet: Americans used streaming platforms to listen to 70.3 billion songs in the first half of 2014, as CD sales and downloads declined.
abstract: Nielsen Soundscan releases data that shows listeners in the United States used audio and video streaming services to listen to 70.3 billion songs in first half of 2014, increase of 42 percent from first half of 2013; data shows that growth appears to have come at expense of traditional sales, with downloads joining CDs as format in decline.
lead_paragraph: Americans used streaming platforms to listen to 70.3 billion songs in the first half of 2014, as CD sales and downloads declined.

headline.main: Downloads in Decline as Streamed Music Soars
headline.print_headline: Downloads in Decline as Streamed Music Soars
